Server

Class ServerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.ServerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ServerController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServerController()
      Creates a ServerSocketListener which creates a ServerGui class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent arg0)
      Because the ServerController acts as an ActionListener it receives ActionEvents for the four buttons in the ServerGui If the Start button is pressed it checks if the port number is indeed a number and if it is between 1025 and 65536.
      void addConnectionHandler(java.lang.String nickName, ConnectionHandler newPlayer)
      Adds a ConnectionHandler to the Connections Map
      void addGame(java.lang.String nameGame, java.util.List<ConnectionHandler> playerList)
      addGame removes the players of a new game from the ActivePlayers map and puts a new entry into the games map.
      void addSecurityPlayer(ConnectionHandler player)
      Because of AMULET the security players need to be added separately.
      void deleteGame(java.lang.String gameName)
      deleteGame removes the entry from the games map that has game as a key.
      java.lang.String getExtensions()
      Returns the AMULET value for which extensions are supported.
      void matchExtensions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extensions, ConnectionHandler player)
      Because of the AMULET protocol the extensions which a client supports must be kept track of.
      void removeConnectionHandler(ConnectionHandler removePlayer)
      Removes a ConnectionHandler from the Connections Map.
      void startChallangeGame(ConnectionHandler player1, ConnectionHandler player2)
      Creates a GameController object which starts a game with players player1 and player2 Used when both players are known.
      void startGame(ConnectionHandler player1)
      This methods handles the situation when there is a new player without challenge capabilities It looks for any other players which are not in a game and selects one randomly It puts them both in a GameController and assigns the GameController to their respective gameController Attributes
      void startServerSocketListener(int portNumber)
      startServerSocketListener creates a new ServerSocket and a new ServerSocketListener.
      void updateActivePlayers()
      updateActivePlayers updates the ActivePlayers list in the ServerGui.
      void updateCurrentGames()
      updateCurrentGames updates the CurrentGames list in the ServerGui.
      void writeToGUI(java.lang.String message)
      Prints a message to the GUI

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerController

        public ServerController()
        Creates a ServerSocketListener which creates a ServerGui class. Sets the AMULET-extensions to "NONE" Initializes all Instance Variables.

    • Method Detail

      • getExtensions

        public java.lang.String getExtensions()
        Returns the AMULET value for which extensions are supported.
        Returns:
        string containg the AMULET value for the extensions

      • startServerSocketListener

        public void startServerSocketListener(int portNumber)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        startServerSocketListener creates a new ServerSocket and a new ServerSocketListener. It also starts the ServerSocketListener Thread.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the number on what port the listener should wait for connections
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an error on the ServerSocket constructor

      • matchExtensions

        public void matchExtensions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extensions,
                            ConnectionHandler player)
                     throws java.lang.Error
        Because of the AMULET protocol the extensions which a client supports must be kept track of. The ServerController puts the connectionHandler in the different extension sets
        Parameters:
        extensions - the ArrayList housing the extensions
        connectionHandler - the player to be matched
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error

      • addSecurityPlayer

        public void addSecurityPlayer(ConnectionHandler player)
        Because of AMULET the security players need to be added separately.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to be added to the Security list

      • addConnectionHandler

        public void addConnectionHandler(java.lang.String nickName,
                                 ConnectionHandler newPlayer)
        Adds a ConnectionHandler to the Connections Map
        Parameters:
        newPlayer - the ConnectionHandler to be added
        nickName - the Nickname of the player

      • startGame

        public void startGame(ConnectionHandler player1)
        This methods handles the situation when there is a new player without challenge capabilities It looks for any other players which are not in a game and selects one randomly It puts them both in a GameController and assigns the GameController to their respective gameController Attributes
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first player
        player2 - the second player

      • startChallangeGame

        public void startChallangeGame(ConnectionHandler player1,
                               ConnectionHandler player2)
        Creates a GameController object which starts a game with players player1 and player2 Used when both players are known.
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first player
        player2 - the second player

      • addGame

        public void addGame(java.lang.String nameGame,
                    java.util.List<ConnectionHandler> playerList)
        addGame removes the players of a new game from the ActivePlayers map and puts a new entry into the games map. The CurrentGames list in the ServerGUI is updated.
        Parameters:
        newGame - the GameController of the new game
        playerList - the List with the ConnectionHandler references of two clients

      • removeConnectionHandler

        public void removeConnectionHandler(ConnectionHandler removePlayer)
        Removes a ConnectionHandler from the Connections Map. It doesn't matter if it has been already deleted by a GameController because calling remove() on a Map does not throw an error.
        Parameters:
        removePlayer - the ConnectionHandler to be removed

      • deleteGame

        public void deleteGame(java.lang.String gameName)
        deleteGame removes the entry from the games map that has game as a key. It updates the CurrentGames list in the GUI. The GameController puts the Client(s) back in the connectionsmap, so that isn't done here.
        Parameters:
        game - the game that has ended and needs to be removed.

      • writeToGUI

        public void writeToGUI(java.lang.String message)
        Prints a message to the GUI
        Parameters:
        string - the message to be printed

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent arg0)
        Because the ServerController acts as an ActionListener it receives ActionEvents for the four buttons in the ServerGui If the Start button is pressed it checks if the port number is indeed a number and if it is between 1025 and 65536. If the port number is legal it calls the startServerSocketListener method.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        arg0 - the ActionEvent that has taken place

      • updateActivePlayers

        public void updateActivePlayers()
        updateActivePlayers updates the ActivePlayers list in the ServerGui. It retrieves the keySet from the connectionsmap It clears the ActivePlayers TextArea. It loops over the entries in the keySet and appends each of them to the TextArea. It also lists the Players in the mainTextArea

      • updateCurrentGames

        public void updateCurrentGames()
        updateCurrentGames updates the CurrentGames list in the ServerGui. It retrieves the valueSet from the gamesmap It clears the CurrentGames TextArea. It loops over the entries in the valueset, creates a game name in the format "i: player 1 vs. player 2" and appends each of them to the TextArea. It also lists the Players in the mainTextArea
